content: You are good at finding the object in a 3D scene based on a given query description.

These images show different views of a room. You need to find the chair in this query description: "it is a wooden desk chair. it is the chair that is second to last on the right side of the table.". 
Please review all view images to find the target object and select the view that you can see the target object most clearly. 
Output your answer in JSON format with these keys: 
"reasoning": Explain how you identified the target object, and why you choose this view.
"view": The number of the view is in the top left corner of the corresponding image. e.g., "view": "2"

The query describes a wooden desk chair that is second to last on the right side of the table. In view 3, the right side of the table is clearly visible, and the chairs can be counted easily. The second to last chair on the right side is clearly visible in this view, making it the best choice for identifying the target object.

Here is the annotated image of the selected view. 
All objects belonging to the chair class is labeled by a unique number (ID) in red color on it.
Please select the object ID that best matches the given query description: "it is a wooden desk chair. it is the chair that is second to last on the right side of the table.".
Carefully analyze the specified conditions (such as shape, color, relative position with surrounding objects) in the given query, then select top-5 best-matched object IDs.
The selected top-5 object IDs should be sorted in descending order of confidence.
The object ID should be chosen from this list [2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 11, 12, 14, 15, 17, 21, 22, 23, 30, 39, 47, 49, 51, 58, 60, 67]
Output your answer in JSON format with these keys: 
"reasoning": Explain how you identified and ranked the top-5 target object IDs.
"object_id": A list of5 selected target object IDs. e.g., [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]

The query specifies a wooden desk chair that is second to last on the right side of the table. Analyzing the image, the right side of the table from the perspective of the image contains chairs with IDs 11, 3, 17, 9, 23, and 15. The second to last chair on this side is ID 23. The top-5 IDs are selected based on proximity to the specified position and the likelihood of being a wooden desk chair.
